Articles.Content:
I know Kerbals have asymmetric faces/eyes, but the floating right eye is quite annoying. Would it be possible to fix this?

![wyNRNpr.png](http://i.imgur.com/wyNRNpr.png)

![hNqPaSw.png](http://i.imgur.com/hNqPaSw.png)
Oh god... that looks really bad xD

Whelp, now I can't unsee that.

*Thanks.*

On topic: yeah that's weird, though not sure how easy it'd be to fix.
Ugh. The number of missions I had to cancel over that!
"I'm ready for my close-up, Mr. DeKerman."

Little known (read: made up) fact about Kerbals is that they have extendable eyes that they can use to look around and look at themselves without a mirror (try clicking windows and zooming in when you are in IVA in some pods/cockpit - that is how it works!)

> On topic: yeah that's weird, though not sure how easy it'd be to fix.

Presumably someone at squad can do 3D modeling, and since they have time to make a whole new female kerbal model, I would think they can fix this fairly quickly. Especially if this is going to be 1.0. Finished games shouldn't have graphical errors of course.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-22T13:03:54Z" title="03/22/2015 01:03  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 22, 2015</time> by r4pt0r**

> 
> On topic: yeah that's weird, though not sure how easy it'd be to fix.

My barely educated guess: around half an hour.

Might be a chance to fix Jebediah's dental problems while they're at it...

![8cf79388286c0c4effd58bd465fb1afe_zps984d19e4.jpg](http://i1378.photobucket.com/albums/ah120/craigmotbey/8cf79388286c0c4effd58bd465fb1afe_zps984d19e4.jpg)

Humph.

Frankly, this is quite ugly.

I mean, *really* ugly. Hopefully it'll be fixed when 1.0/0.99/whatever the next version is comes out.
I think they coud fix this by making the eye model circlur instead of basicly stuck on with space tape

> 
> Presumably someone at squad can do 3D modeling, and since they have time to make a whole new female kerbal model, I would think they can fix this fairly quickly. Especially if this is going to be 1.0. Finished games shouldn't have graphical errors of course.

Most "finished games" have a plethora of graphical problems, just not visible unless you dig for them. 

> 
> My barely educated guess: around half an hour.

This... strongly depends on what is causing it. Sometimes it could be as "simple" as a bad union between two primatives; other times it could be problems with the normal face (if that poly was reversed for what ever reason), in other times it could be even deeper issues resulting from bad mapping, or other rendering issues.

I have 'extremely minor' experience here, of course; but sometimes even small tiny errors can become nightmares in figuring out why it is happening. Hopefully it is as simple as just filling the hanging edge to the face; but who knows what is really going on.

> 
> My barely educated guess: around half an hour.

It depends on how the eye is connected to the animation. It may be as simple as extending the mesh into the head, but doing that may mess up other things. If they would do an art-pass on kerbals and fix the eye and mouth issues, and any other issues that come up, kerbals might be 1.0 ready.
While I think this should be fixed before 1.0 hits us, I'd rather Squad fix other more intrusive bugs first.
Eyes are separate meshes from the head, so extending the right eyeball should fix the issue without breaking anything.

This shows up for me, but I have every graphic setting turned down all the way (and I still run at 15 FPS on the main menu:() so that's what I always attributed it to. KSP was never that focused on graphics anyway (though the game still looks beautiful).
